title: Asian markets move higher after Trump announces initial trade agreement with China
text:
Hong Kong (CNN Business) Asian markets traded in the green Monday after the United States said it reached an initial agreement on trade with China.

Shanghai Composite Index SHCOMP China'simproved 1.5%, following a 0.9% rise on Friday.

Kospi KOSPI South Korea'sjumped as much as 1.5% in early trading. It's currently up 1.2%. The Kospi also ended positive Friday.

Hang Seng Index HSI Hong Kong'sopened up 0.8% and is currently up 1.1%. The index seems likely to extend its gains from Friday, when it logged its biggest daily increase in more than a month.

Japanese markets were closed Monday for a holiday.
